QA:
what happens if you choose OK to check it out again?
Could you please try the EPF 1.0?

Current code is validating method configuration, eventually adding additional method packages to configuration, when the configuration is being opened or refreshed in the configuration editor. This explains why check-out prompt showed up when you do a "Team / Refresh Status..." on the library with newly checked-in configuration file. That action triggered a refresh of configuration editor.

I have fixed the "invalid thread access" exception so user will not see any error after clicking on [Cancel] in the check-out prompt dialog box.

We should not make any change to the configuration when it is opened/refreshed in editor. Validation with change must be either a explicit action or can be performed during saving editor.

Reassigned this to Jinhua to fix.
fixed. the configuration closure does not need to call validation since it was called in the UI code when the configuration is changed.
Verified on EPF 1.2 1.2.0.2 build 20071105-1846 and closed.
